replies.msg:
As per the rules, a squad of maximum 25 players, with no more than 17 non-homegrown, are allowed to be registered. Homegrown players (HGP) are defined as players who spent a minimum of 36 months registered with a club in England or Wales before the end of the season in which they turn 21. Players who are still under 21 do not count towards either limit, which explains why Chelsea’s U21 list includes every player in the youth teams.

non-HGP (17): Alonso, Arrizabalaga, Azpilicueta, Caballero, David Luiz, Emerson, Giroud, Hazard, Jorginho, Kante, Kovacic, Morata, Pedro, Piazon, Rudiger, Willian, Zappacosta

HGP (8): Barkley, Cahill, Christensen, Drinkwater, Fabregas, Green, Moses, Loftus-Cheek

U-21 (3+): Ampadu, Hudson-Odoi, Bulka, etc.

replies.msg: Chelsea have failed to score in consecutive home league matches for the first time since November 2012 (they did it this time last year in the league and Cup).
Matt Law: Fabregas very clearly saying his goodbyes at the final whistle

quote.msg: Matt Law: Fabregas very clearly saying his goodbyes at the final whistle

replies.msg: Sarri on frustrationing day: “I tried to do my job I think. On the bench, I tried to do my job. I think we did a good job for 80 metres of the pitch, but I think we were in trouble in the last 20” #CFC #CHESOU

Sarri on lack of goals: “We have to solve the problems in the last 15 or 20 metres. In the last matches we have been in control, everywhere and against every team. In this moment it is not easy to score the first goal. The performance was good.” #CFC #CHESOU

Sarri says he is going to try to improve Chelsea on the training pitch and not in the transfer market. Ends on transfers: “It depends on the board and not me.” #CFC #CHESOU
Sarri is unsure about whether Morata’s goal should have been ruled offside. Points to Giroud’s two goals in the last match, says they have been difficult calls. #CFC #CHESOU

Sarri on Willian and whether Pulisic should have arrived now: “I don’t know. I am not in charge of the market. It is very difficult to speak about the market or the deal of Pulisic. The board knows my opinion but I think that Willian’s injury is not serious” #CFC #CHESOU

Sarri on injuries: “I think Pedro in one week will be able to have training with his team-mates. Of course, in this match it was difficult for me. Pedro out, Giroud out, Hudson-Odoi out. Willian out after 30 mins. I had one attacking player, Loftus-Cheek, but he wasn’t 100% #CFC

Sarri says Giroud should be back in training in 10 days.

Sarri on using Fabregas: “I used him because we didn’t move the ball like we did in the first half. I wanted a technical player because I wanted to improve with moving the ball.” #CFC #CHESOU

Sarri after being asked about bringing back Batshuayi: “I think we need someone with new characteristics.” #CFC #CHESOU

I think that he meant that Batshuayi isn’t the right type of player that he needs. It wasn’t completely clear though. He was asked about Batshuayi last time and refuted that he would recall.

replies.msg:
Shearer admitted that he has been left confused by what Sarri is trying to achieve with Chelsea players after their latest setback.

"Is Sarriball when they ask a midfielder to get on the ball and pass it around," he asked when urged to give his view on Chelsea's inconsistent form on BBC Radio Five Live.

"Hasn't that happened since football started, no? I was just wondering exactly what it was, giving the ball to a centre-half, who can then give it to a midfielder who can then try and control the game.

"I don't think that's anything new to football, do you? Has no other team tried to play football through the middle of the park?"

replies.msg:
Chelsea boss Maurizio Sarri struggling to hide frustration at club's transfer policy

Only last week the 59-year-old seemed to lay the blame at Eden Hazard’s refusal so far to sign a new contract at the hierarchy’s door as much as the player in question.

“I have not the power to do this,” he said. “I am the coach. I am not the president and not in charge of the market. I think we have to solve the problem if we want to programme the future.”

It was a rather bizarre thing to say given Chelsea have made it clear for over a year that they are prepared to give the Belgian in excess of £300,000-a-week to convince him to stay on.
